intro: Ludwigia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in wetland and aquatic environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It often grows in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams. Ludwigia oppositifolia is valued in aquatic horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in water gardens.
